dict.string: Which of the four factors (i.e. the four factors that determine every emergence in the world) can we NOT influence?
First factor: Source
Second factor: Source's development
Third factor: External factors directly related to the source
Fourth factor: External factors not directly related to the source
If we cannot influence the first factor, the source, how can we influence the other three factors, by which the source changes in its individual parts, and sometimes in its general part as well?
We cannot influence the other three factors either
Through fate
Through our choice of environment
Through meditation
What constitutes an environment that can help a person advance spiritually?
Friends, books, teachers
Trees, birds, fresh air
Any place of complete solitude
Any high places, such as mountain tops
Which of the following is NOT a definition of "friends" as one of the means to advance spiritually?
People who share a common desire for spirituality
People who share a natural closeness to each other
People who aim themselves at attaining adhesion with the Creator
People with a point in the heart who try to connect those points together
Which of the following is NOT a definition of "books" as one of the means to advance spiritually?
Books written by people with spiritual attainment
Books on philosophy, religion, psychology, new age, spirituality
Text written in the language of roots & branches
Books written at a higher spiritual level
Which of the following is NOT a definition of "teacher" as one of the means to advance spiritually?
A higher spiritual degree
A person at a higher spiritual degree permitted to guide students to spirituality
Guidance from a higher spiritual degree
A person who has been granted certification as a spiritual teacher
Where does a person have free will?
A person has no free will
In the choice of an environment of friends, books & teachers that impart spiritual concepts & advice
In the choice to enter any environment that appears to the person & read any book that s/he comes by
In the choice of pain over pleasure
What is the precondition for free will?
Birth into this world
Being a homo sapien
Having a point in the heart (i.e. desire for spirituality)
Being raised in an environment that provides all of person's needs
Which of the following is NOT a reason why there is no free will in achieving any corporeal goals (i.e. on the levels of food, sex, family, money, honor, control, knowledge)?
Corporeal goals are depicted in one's desire to receive pleasure for one's own personal benefit, without one's choice
Corporeal goals involuntarily appear in a person according to one's innate characteristics (1st & 2nd factors) & one's environmental conditioning (3rd & 4th factors)
With corporeal goals, a person cannot choose anything but what appears as best for that person according to what the society that person is in appreciates
With corporeal goals, a person cannot choose pain in the present for pleasure in the future
Which of the following is NOT a reason why there is free will in attaining the spiritual goal (i.e. adhesion with the Creator, balance with Nature, equivalence of form with the quality of bestowal)?
The spiritual goal cannot be depicted in one's nature, i.e. the desire to receive pleasure for one's own personal benefit, thus a person cannot be involuntarily led to it

A characteristic of the spiritual goal is constant bestowal, which requires constant efforts to choose the friends, books & teachers (i.e. the spiritual environment) outside one's inborn desire to receive pleasure
The spiritual goal requires that a person be able to choose pain over pleasure
The spiritual goal is in the intention to bestow pleasure above the desire to receive pleasure, not in the desire to receive pleasure itself, which appears in one involuntarily
